company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act.&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial Unicode MS;font-size:10pt;">&#9744;</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div is a shell company (as defined in Rule&#160;12b-2 of the Exchange Act).&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#160;Yes</span><span solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51683263e2329-wk-Fact-13911AB6ADF8E5D9505E61D90DBF2C18" name="us-gaap:CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents" contextRef="FI2019Q3" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2,309</ix:nonFraction></span></span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The accompanying notes are an integral part of these Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">NORTONLIFELOCK INC.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;">(Unaudited)</span></div><div><a id="s9406E9793FD33CE669FD61D904B1DCE5"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 1</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">.&#160;</span><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock" id="TextSelection-2BD24A5717ADA724DC0761D90DF1CBC1-0-wk-Fact-C685F61BB71321CF09FE61D90DEB1738" continuedAt="TextSelection-2BD24A5717ADA724DC0761D90DF1CBC1-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Basis of Presentation and Significant Accounting Policies</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-2BD24A5717ADA724DC0761D90DF1CBC1-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent Corporate Name Change</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In connection with the sale of certain assets of our Enterprise Security business as disclosed in Basis of presentation below, effective November 4, 2019, we changed our corporate name from Symantec Corporation to NortonLifeLock Inc.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Basis of presentation</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-A0C729D252CA497C5FB661D90DF103F2-0-wk-Fact-800CD58AA402AAC691C561D90DEBB45E" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On August 8, 2019, we entered into a definitive agreement with Broadcom Inc. (Broadcom) under which Broadcom agreed to purchase certain of our Enterprise Security assets and assume certain liabilities for a purchase price of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51683437e499-wk-Fact-D0D668528EA5351E87D661D90DEAF29A" name="us-gaap:DisposalGroupIncludingDiscontinuedOperationConsideration" contextRef="I2019Q3August08_us-gaap_DisposalGroupClassificationAxis_us-gaap_DiscontinuedOperationsDisposedOfBySaleMember_us-gaap_IncomeStatementBalanceSheetAndAdditionalDisclosuresByDisposalGroupsIncludingDiscontinuedOperationsAxis_symc_EnterpriseSecurityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-8" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">10.7</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> (the Broadcom sale). On </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">November&#160;4, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we completed the transaction. The divestiture of our Enterprise Security business allows us to shift our operational focus to our consumer business and represents a strategic shift in our operations. As a result, the majority of results of our Enterprise Security business were classified as discontinued operations in our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and thus excluded from both continuing operations and segment results for all periods presented. We have operated in </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51683437e507-wk-Fact-A5FF407802C948009F8861D90DEC70D3" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="D2020Q3Nov05toJan03" unitRef="segment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">one</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> reportable segment since the second quarter of fiscal 2020. The Enterprise Security business was part of our Enterprise Security segment. Results of discontinued operations include all revenues and expenses directly derived from the Enterprise Security business, with the exception of revenues and associated costs of our ID Analytics solutions, which were formerly included in the Enterprise Security segment, and general corporate overhead which were previously allocated to the Enterprise Security segment but are not allocated to discontinued operations. These revenues and expenses are now included in continuing operations. The assets acquired and liabilities to be sold to Broadcom, as specified in the August 8, 2019 definitive agreement, were classified as discontinued operations in our Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets, subject to changes set forth in the agreement. See Notes 3 and 18 for additional information about the divestiture of our Enterprise Security business</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The accompanying unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements have been prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) in the United States of America (U.S.) for interim financial information. In the opinion of management, the unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements contain all adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring items, except as otherwise noted, necessary for the fair presentation of our financial position, results of operations, and cash flows for the interim periods. These unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements should be read in conjunction with the audited Consolidated Financial Statements and accompanying Notes thereto included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">March&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The results of operations for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended January 3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> are not necessarily indicative of the results expected for the entire fiscal year.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:FiscalPeriod" id="TextSelection-74B5DDE9A509027BEC6861D90DF0115D-0-wk-Fact-568CC4D5183B42C183A061D90DEA4150" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We have a 52/53-week fiscal year ending on the Friday closest to March&#160;31. Unless otherwise stated, references to three and six-month periods in this report relate to fiscal periods ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. The three and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> consisted of 13 and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">40</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> weeks, respectively, whereas the three and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> consisted of 13 and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">39</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> weeks, respectively. Our </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> fiscal year consists of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">53</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> weeks and ends on </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">April&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:UseOfEstimates" id="TextSelection-2B24F9445FC4A1082C3361D90DEF48D9-0-wk-Fact-B3BF74BEB5185C3D768761D90DEC6A12" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Use of estimates </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The preparation of Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements in conformity with U.S. GAAP requires management to make estimates, judgments and assumptions that affect the amounts reported and disclosed in the financial statements and accompanying notes. Such estimates include, but are not limited to, the determination of stand-alone selling price for performance obligations, valuation of business combinations including acquired intangible assets and goodwill, loss contingencies, valuation of stock-based compensation, and the recognition and measurement of current and deferred income taxes, including the measurement of uncertain tax positions. Management determines these estimates and assumptions based on historical experience and on various other assumptions that are believed to be reasonable. Actual results could differ significantly from these estimates, and such differences may be material to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Significant accounting policies</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">There have been no material changes to our significant accounting policies as of and for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended January 3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, except for those noted in </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Note 2</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Note 5</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, as compared to the significant accounting policies described in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">March&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">9</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s7FF5736939FD718BCB7761D9079E47A9"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 2</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">. </span><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:DescriptionOfNewAccountingPronouncementsNotYetAdopted" id="TextSelection-77BE48A4F07E3DA2A19861D90DFCC755-0-wk-Fact-EE0126111BA233997E0761D90DF97907" continuedAt="TextSelection-77BE48A4F07E3DA2A19861D90DFCC755-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Standards</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-A8DA291C8D9AC036ABB261D90DFC75C5-0-wk-Fact-E5291F7CAE98CB3B725461D90DF96CC3" escape="true"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-77BE48A4F07E3DA2A19861D90DFCC755-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Recently adopted authoritative guidance</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:12px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Leases. </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In February 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued new guidance on lease accounting which requires lessees to recognize assets and liabilities on their balance sheet for the rights and obligations created by operating leases and also requires disclosures designed to give users of financial statements information on the amount, timing, and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases. Most prominent among the changes in the standard is the recognition of right-of-use (ROU) assets and lease liabilities by lessees for those leases classified as operating leases. Under the standard, disclosures are required to meet the objective of enabling users of financial statements to assess the amount, timing, and uncertainty of cash flows arising from leases.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On March 30, 2019, the first day of our fiscal 2020, we adopted the new guidance using the alternative modified retrospective transition method under which we continue to apply the legacy lease accounting guidance, including its disclosure requirements, in comparative periods prior to fiscal 2020. In addition, we elected the package of practical expedients permitted under the transition guidance within the new standard that allowed us not to reassess (1) whether any expired or existing contracts are or contain leases, (2) lease classification for any expired or existing leases, and (3) initial direct costs for any existing leases. We currently do not have any finance leases. We combine the lease and non-lease components in determining the operating lease assets and liabilities. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The adoption of the new lease accounting standard resulted in the recognition of ROU assets and lease liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51683516e501-wk-Fact-C5A8CE263F3A29A77F9C61D90DF8FD03" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="I2020Q1March30_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">182</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51683516e505-wk-Fact-BD4C99E057751527429561D90DFAA3B9" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="I2020Q1March30_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">209</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, as of March 30, 2019 related to our operating leases. The adoption of the standard also resulted in elimination of deferred rent liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51683516e509-wk-Fact-3B2C044762FC14E895F961D90DF88F6B" name="us-gaap:DeferredRentCredit" contextRef="FI2019Q4_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">17</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, as of March 30, 2019, which are now recorded as a reduction of the ROU assets. The standard did not have an impact on our consolidated statements of operations or statements of cash flows. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Recently issued authoritative guidance not yet adopted</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Credit Losses.</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> In June 2016, the FASB issued new authoritative guidance on credit losses which changes the impairment model for most financial assets and certain other instruments. For trade receivables and other instruments, we will be required to use a new forward-looking &#8220;expected loss&#8221; model. Additionally, for available-for-sale debt securities with unrealized losses, we will measure credit losses in a manner similar to today, except that the losses will be recognized as allowances rather than reductions in the amortized cost of the securities. The standard will be effective for us in our first quarter of fiscal 2021. We are currently evaluating the impact of the adoption of this guidance on our Consolidated Financial Statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Internal-Use Software. </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In August 2018, the FASB issued new guidance that clarifies the accounting for implementation costs in a cloud computing arrangement. The new guidance aligns the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred in a hosting arrangement that is a service contract with the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred to develop or obtain internal-use software. The standard will be effective for us in our first quarter of fiscal 2021. We are currently evaluating the impact of the adoption of this guidance on our Consolidated Financial Statements and disclosures. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Income taxes</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. In December 2019, the FASB issued new guidance that simplifies the accounting for income taxes by removing certain exceptions to the general principles in Topic 740. The guidance also clarifies and amends existing guidance to improve consistent application. The standard will be effective for us in our first quarter of fiscal 2023, with early adoption permitted. We are currently evaluating the adoption date and the impact of the adoption of this guidance on our Consolidated Financial Statements and disclosures.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Although there are several other new accounting pronouncements issued or proposed by the FASB that we have adopted or will adopt, as applicable, we do not believe any of these accounting pronouncements has had, or will have, a material impact on our consolidated financial position, operating results or disclosures.</span></div></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric><div><a id="sCB26FBCACF181DF57C7361D903067DF0"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 3</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">. </span><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:DisposalGroupsIncludingDiscontinuedOperationsDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-9258D3304F90EFE0BA4461D90E6C8FE7-0-wk-Fact-92E8F9818B898EDC40B961D90E616CC9" continuedAt="TextSelection-9258D3304F90EFE0BA4461D90E6C8FE7-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Divestiture and Discontinued Operations</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;"> </span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-9258D3304F90EFE0BA4461D90E6C8FE7-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-9258D3304F90EFE0BA4461D90E6C8FE7-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Divestiture of Enterprise Security Assets</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On August 8, 2019, we entered into a definitive agreement with Broadcom under which Broadcom agreed to purchase certain of our Enterprise Security assets and assume certain liabilities for a purchase price of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51685602e490-wk-Fact-D0D668528EA5351E87D661D90DEAF29A" name="us-gaap:DisposalGroupIncludingDiscontinuedOperationConsideration" contextRef="I2019Q3August08_us-gaap_DisposalGroupClassificationAxis_us-gaap_DiscontinuedOperationsDisposedOfBySaleMember_us-gaap_IncomeStatementBalanceSheetAndAdditionalDisclosuresByDisposalGroupsIncludingDiscontinuedOperationsAxis_symc_EnterpriseSecurityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-8" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">10.7</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. <ix:continuation id="TextSelection-6F588B8E0068BE751827850E2C84CFA1-0" continuedAt="TextSelection-6F588B8E0068BE751827850E2C84CFA1-1">On </ix:continuation></span><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-6F588B8E0068BE751827850E2C84CFA1-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-6F588B8E0068BE751827850E2C84CFA1-2"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">November&#160;4, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we completed the transaction and recognized a gain on sale of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction equipment, and data center co-locations under operating leases that expire on various dates through fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2029</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Our leases generally have terms that range from </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51688302e488-wk-Fact-90E2012E0F489A857F4E61D90EE5137A" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_symc_FacilitiesMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">1</ix:nonNumeric> year</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51688302e492-wk-Fact-7AA428F41E02AF050DA161D90EE245B3" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_symc_FacilitiesMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">17</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> for our facilities, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51688302e496-wk-Fact-63C44576D610D20F36FA61D90EE4C2B0" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaap_EquipmentMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">1</ix:nonNumeric> year</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51688302e500-wk-Fact-72FEABECD3CBAAE208FA61D90EE4EC9C" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaap_EquipmentMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">6</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> for equipment, and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51688302e505-wk-Fact-3D8A2E753FC017B63E3F61D90EE21C8F" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_symc_DataCenterColocationsMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">1</ix:nonNumeric> year</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51688302e509-wk-Fact-66CCE9C83B29E7DB1B8A61D90EE2C517" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_symc_DataCenterColocationsMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">6</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> for data center co-locations. Some of our leases contain renewal options, escalation clauses, rent concessions, and leasehold improvement incentives.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:LesseeLeasesPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-61CB804E433E1287F34561D90EEB7C2E-0-wk-Fact-B9CE78E599CEF37C5F8861D90EE3BFB4" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We determine if an arrangement is a lease at inception. We have elected to not recognize a lease liability or ROU asset for short-term leases (leases with a term of twelve months or less that do not include an option to purchase the underlying asset). Operating lease ROU assets and operating lease liabilities are recognized based on the present value of the future minimum lease payments over the lease term at commencement date. The interest rate we use to determine the present value of future payments is our incremental borrowing rate because the rate implicit in our leases is not readily determinable. Our incremental borrowing rate is a hypothetical rate for collateralized borrowings in economic environments where the leased asset is located based on credit rating factors. Our operating lease assets also include adjustments for prepaid lease payments</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">,</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> lease incentives and initial direct costs</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">.</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Certain lease contracts include obligations to pay for other services, such as operations and maintenance. We elected the practical expedient whereby we record all lease components and the related minimum non-lease components as a single lease component. Cash payments made for variable lease costs are not included in the measurement of our operating lease assets and liabilities. Many of our lease terms include one or more options to renew. We do not assume renewals in our determination of the lease term unless it is reasonably certain that we will exercise that option. Lease costs for minimum lease payments for operating leases is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term. Our lease agreements do not contain any residual value guarantees. </span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:LeaseCostTableTextBlock" style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, the maturities of our lease liabilities, excluding lease liabilities associated with our discontinued operations, by fiscal year are as follows:</span><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="sBF45C100C2F82DBE5FD261D90350708D"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 8</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">. </span><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" id="TextSelection-16E48BA6E5F1FF844DE061D9106C5DDD-0-wk-Fact-4B97F9B9964DB435908B61D9106616C6" continuedAt="TextSelection-16E48BA6E5F1FF844DE061D9106C5DDD-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Financial Instruments and Fair Value Measurements</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-16E48BA6E5F1FF844DE061D9106C5DDD-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-16E48BA6E5F1FF844DE061D9106C5DDD-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For financial instruments measured at fair value, fair value is the price that would be received from selling an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. When determining fair value, we consider the principal or most advantageous market in which we would transact, and we consider assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or liability.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The three levels of inputs that may be used to measure fair value are:</span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Level&#160;1:&#160;Quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.</span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Level&#160;2:&#160;Observable inputs other than Level 1 prices, such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in less active markets or model-derived valuations. All significant inputs used in our valuations, such as discounted cash flows, are observable or can be derived principally from or corroborated with observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities.</span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Level&#160;3:&#160;Unobservable inputs to the valuation methodology that are significant to the measurement of the fair value of assets or liabilities. We monitor and review the inputs and results of these valuation models to help ensure the fair value measurements are reasonable and consistent with market experience in similar asset classes.</span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Assets measured and recorded at fair value on a recurring basis</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:FairValueAssetsMeasuredOnRecurringBasisTextBlock" id="TextSelection-496B4CAA41224F8B1C4D61D9106C8BFB-0-wk-Fact-1BA9FCA30326AC546E4B61D91066CBFA" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The following table summarizes our financial instruments measured at fair value on a recurring basis:</span></div><div Additionally, as of March 29, 2019, the principal amount and associated unamortized discount and issuance costs of the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51696434e1726-wk-Fact-A7C3CF8F1411DD7ADDFDFB5D065C9734" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="I2016Q4Mar4_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_symc_A2.5ConvertibleSeniorNotesDueApril12021Member_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_ConvertibleDebtMember" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.5</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> Convertible Notes were classified as current because upon the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">4</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">-year anniversary of the issuance of the notes, holders of thereof had the option to require us to repurchase the notes, in cash, equal to the principal amount and accrued and unpaid interest of the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51696434e1734-wk-Fact-A7C3CF8F1411DD7ADDFDFB5D065C9734" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="I2016Q4Mar4_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_symc_A2.5ConvertibleSeniorNotesDueApril12021Member_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_ConvertibleDebtMember" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.5</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> Convertible Notes.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Holders of the Convertible Senior Notes could convert the notes into our common stock at any time up to the maturity date of each note. A fundamental change, as defined, includes a sale of substantially all our assets, a change of the control of NortonLifeLock, or a plan for our liquidation or dissolution. The conversion rates under the Convertible Senior Notes are subject to customary anti-dilution adjustments. If the holders request a conversion, we have the option to settle the par amount of the Convertible Senior Notes using cash, shares of our common stock, or a combination of cash and shares with the cash settlement not exceeding the principal amount and accrued and unpaid interest of the Convertible Senior Notes.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 1</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">0</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">. </span><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsAndHedgingActivitiesDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-22E444056EF6E81E21CE61D910F28A8E-0-wk-Fact-9E6F6FCB1F6B2F9716E161D910EEB963" continuedAt="TextSelection-22E444056EF6E81E21CE61D910F28A8E-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Derivatives</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-22E444056EF6E81E21CE61D910F28A8E-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-22E444056EF6E81E21CE61D910F28A8E-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We conduct business in numerous currencies throughout our worldwide operations, and our entities hold monetary assets or liabilities, earn revenues, or incur costs in currencies other than the entity&#8217;s functional currency. As a result, we are exposed to foreign exchange gains or losses which impacts our operating results. As part of our foreign currency risk mitigation strategy, we have entered into foreign exchange forward contracts with up to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51694671e489-wk-Fact-189A2F47F46BCCF35FFF61D910F099D5" name="us-gaap:DerivativeTermOfContract" contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaap_ForeignExchangeForwardMember" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">twelve months</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in duration. We do not use derivative financial instruments for speculative trading purposes, nor do we hedge our foreign currency exposure in a manner that entirely offsets the effects of the changes in foreign exchange rates.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">To help protect the net investment in a foreign operation from adverse changes in foreign currency exchange rates, we conduct a program under which we may enter into foreign currency forward and option contracts to offset the changes in the carrying amounts of these investments due to fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates. We exclude changes in forward points for the forward contracts from the assessment of hedge effectiveness. We recognize changes in the excluded component in other income (expense), net. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, the fair value of these contracts was insignificant. During the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, a net loss of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51694671e508-wk-Fact-2B5C1ADD9D0432B2B10661D910EE391E" name="us-gaap:OtherComprehensiveIncomeLossNetInvestmentHedgeGainLossBeforeReclassificationAndTax" contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> was recorded in </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Accumulated other comprehensive loss</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We also enter into foreign currency forward contracts to hedge foreign currency balance sheet exposure. These forward contracts are not designated as hedging instruments. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, the fair value of these contracts was insignificant. <ix:nonNumeric style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><a id="s38FCA093300DFA90BC0561D903974267"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 11</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">.&#160;<ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedActivitiesDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-82C0904883B634E4EB2E61D9113D4CA8-0-wk-Fact-9C60D14C063E615DE6E461D911388FEB" continuedAt="TextSelection-82C0904883B634E4EB2E61D9113D4CA8-1" escape="true">Restructuring, Transition and Other Costs</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-82C0904883B634E4EB2E61D9113D4CA8-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-82C0904883B634E4EB2E61D9113D4CA8-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our restructuring, transition and other costs consist primarily of severance, facilities, separation, transition and other related costs. Severance costs generally include severance payments, outplacement services, health insurance coverage, and legal costs. Included in other exit and disposal costs are advisory fees incurred in connection with restructuring events and facilities exit costs, which generally include rent expense and lease termination costs, less estimated sublease income. Separation costs primarily consist of consulting costs incurred in connection with the divestiture of our Enterprise Security business. Transition costs are incurred in connection with Board of Directors approved discrete strategic information technology transformation initiatives and primarily consist of consulting charges associated with our enterprise resource planning and supporting systems and costs to automate business processes. Such transition projects were completed by the end of fiscal 2019.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">November 2019 Plan</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In November 2019, our Board of Directors approved a restructuring plan (the November 2019 Plan) in connection with the strategic decision to divest our Enterprise Security business. Actions under this plan include the reduction of our workforce by approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e494-wk-Fact-F65166711A84CDAE9487C3417C5E5547" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostNumberOfPositionsEliminated" contextRef="D2019Q3Nov30-Nov30_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_November2019PlanMember" unitRef="employees" decimals="-2" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3,100</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> employees, as well as asset write-offs, contract terminations, facilities closures, and the sale of underutilized facilities. We estimate that we will incur total costs of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e498-wk-Fact-F2912D533C1A4F00581EC342FBDD59C6" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostExpectedCost1" contextRef="I2019Q3Nov30_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_November2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">800</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in connection with the November 2019 Plan, of which approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e502-wk-Fact-4F034FDA24D1F804757DC343FEA2F2DB" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostExpectedCost1" contextRef="I2019Q3Nov30_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_November2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">330</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> are expected to consist of cash expenditures for severance and termination benefits and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e506-wk-Fact-21D7511F5CD0A9C97CA5F0E734423C23" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostExpectedCost1" contextRef="I2019Q3Nov30_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_ContractTerminationMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_November2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">170</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> of cash expenditures for contract terminations. These actions are expected to be completed within the next </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d51700996e510-wk-Fact-44A35682EC0DD3F1B9EDFCC7BE366577" name="symc:RestructuringAndRelatedCostCompletionPeriod" contextRef="D2019Q3Nov30-Nov30_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_November2019PlanMember" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">twelve months</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we have incurred costs of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e519-wk-Fact-13EFA8BB4BFD39C76369C344439F678D" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostCostIncurredToDate1" contextRef="FI2020Q3_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_November2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">285</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> related to our November 2019 Plan. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In addition, as a result of our divestiture, our Board of Directors approved an equity-based severance program under which certain equity awards to certain terminated employees were accelerated. See Note 14 for more information on the impact of this program.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;">August 2019 Plan</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On August 6, 2019, our Board of Directors approved a restructuring plan&#160;(the August 2019 Plan) to improve productivity and reduce complexity in the way we manage the business.&#160;We expect to reduce net global headcount by approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e532-wk-Fact-0B46CDEC37DD07066B3C61D91137800D" name="symc:RestructuringandRelatedCostExpectedNumberofPositionsEliminatedPercent" contextRef="D2019Q3August06_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_August2019PlanMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">7</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> under the August 2019 Plan. We also plan to downsize, vacate or close certain facilities and data centers in connection with the restructuring plan. We estimate that we will incur total costs in connection with the restructuring of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e536-wk-Fact-7AC7F96B094F55928FB161D911367175" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostExpectedCost1" contextRef="I2019Q3August06_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_August2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">100</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e540-wk-Fact-A8167A2B6DDE0B6486C861D911362E1E" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostExpectedCost1" contextRef="I2019Q3August06_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_August2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">75</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> for severance and termination benefits and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e544-wk-Fact-B374A46C05D42854EA7A61D911362926" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostExpectedCost1" contextRef="I2019Q3August06_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_FacilityClosingMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_August2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">25</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> for site closures. These actions are expected to be completed in fiscal 2020. As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we have incurred costs of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e553-wk-Fact-7A89653C878AB7D5445B61D91137D439" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostCostIncurredToDate1" contextRef="FI2020Q3_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_August2019PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">53</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> related to our Fiscal 2020 Plan. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;">August 2018 Plan</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In August 2018, we announced a restructuring plan (the August 2018 Plan) under which we incurred costs of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51700996e563-wk-Fact-48372D4A59DCE6CD9C4761D91137C4FC" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostCostIncurredToDate1" contextRef="FI2020Q2_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_symc_August2018PlanMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">48</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> as of October 4, 2019. These actions were substantially completed in fiscal 2020. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Restructuring, transition and other costs summary</span></div><ix:nonNumeric style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our effective tax rate for continuing operations for fiscal 2020 was based on the statutory tax rate of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">21%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Our effective tax rate for continuing operations for the three and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> differs from the federal statutory income tax rate primarily due to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">a discrete tax charge of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51699330e952-wk-Fact-2ED78663B54273CB922511D7E03DD03C" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxReconciliationDispositionOfAssets" contextRef="FD2020Q3QTD_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_symc_DigicertParentInc.Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">53</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> recorded to account for the sale of DigiCert equity investment, </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">various permanent differences and state taxes, partially offset by the benefits of lower-taxed international earnings and the research and development tax credit. In addition, for the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, there was an additional tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51699330e967-wk-Fact-0239DA7563224A80DDBD61D911559EC5" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD_srt_LitigationCaseAxis_symc_AlteraCorp.v.CommissionerMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">62</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> recorded to account for uncertain tax positions related to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals recent holding in Altera Corp. v. Commissioner.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our effective tax rate for income (loss) from continuing operations for the three and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> differs from the federal statutory income tax rate primarily due to the tax expense recorded to account for one-time adjustments related to guidance issued on the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (H.R.1) (Tax Reform) and other changes in response to the Tax Reform, various permanent differences, and state taxes, partially offset by the benefits of lower-taxed international earnings and the research and development tax credit.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On July 27, 2015, the United States Tax Court (Tax Court) issued its opinion in Altera Corp. v. Commissioner and concluded that related parties in a cost sharing arrangement are not required to share expenses related to stock-based compensation. The Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service appealed the Tax Court decision to the Ninth Circuit. In June 2019, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit reversed the July 2015 decision of the U.S. Tax Court. As a result of this decision, we recorded a cumulative income tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51699330e985-wk-Fact-0239DA7563224A80DDBD61D911559EC5" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD_srt_LitigationCaseAxis_symc_AlteraCorp.v.CommissionerMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">62</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. On July 22, 2019, the taxpayer requested a rehearing before the full Ninth Circuit, but such request was denied on November 12, 2019. Nevertheless, the taxpayer may still file an appeal with the United States Supreme Court. Consequently, the final outcome of the case is uncertain. If the Altera Ninth Circuit Panel Opinion is reversed, we would anticipate recording an income tax benefit at that time.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:EarningsPerShareTextBlock" id="TextSelection-B00A1A812E87619D7FFC61D911CD9957-0-wk-Fact-F83F867E87B5D93D574861D911CAC966" continuedAt="TextSelection-B00A1A812E87619D7FFC61D911CD9957-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Net Income Per Share</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-B00A1A812E87619D7FFC61D911CD9957-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-B00A1A812E87619D7FFC61D911CD9957-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:normal;">Basic income per share is computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted net income per share also includes the incremental effect of dilutive potentially issuable common shares outstanding during the period using the treasury stock method. Dilutive potentially issuable common shares includes the dilutive effect of the shares underlying convertible debt and employee equity awards. </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Diluted loss per share was the same as basic loss per share for the three and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:normal;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:normal;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, as there was a loss from continuing operations in the period and inclusion of potentially issuable shares was anti-dilutive.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">25</span></div></div><hr style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 16</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">.&#160;</span><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-4579D69A6919C165DC4B61D9124895A1-0-wk-Fact-A4009C5EFA9A79E72ED561D91243E7B8" continuedAt="TextSelection-4579D69A6919C165DC4B61D9124895A1-1" escape="true"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Segment and Geographic Information</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-4579D69A6919C165DC4B61D9124895A1-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-4579D69A6919C165DC4B61D9124895A1-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Historically, we operated in </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51708277e490-wk-Fact-9B46EFCB466CCC83CC5461D9124222E3" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="D2020Q2Mar30toAug07" unitRef="segment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> reportable segments: Enterprise Security and Consumer Cyber Safety. The Enterprise Security segment focused on providing our Integrated Cyber Defense solutions to help business and government customers unify cloud and on-premises security to deliver a more effective cyber defense solution, while driving down cost and complexity. The Consumer Cyber Safety segment focused on providing cyber safety solutions under our NortonLifeLock brand to help consumers protect their devices, online privacy, identities, and home networks. On August 8, 2019, we entered into a definitive agreement to sell certain assets of our Enterprise Security business to Broadcom, representing substantially all of our Enterprise Security segment. This transaction closed on November&#160;4, 2019. The divestiture of these Enterprise Security assets allows us to shift our operational focus to our consumer business and represents a strategic shift in our operations. Therefore, the results of our divested Enterprise Security assets were classified as discontinued operations in our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and thus excluded from both continuing operations and segment results for all periods presented. Accordingly, we now have </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d51708277e494-wk-Fact-A5FF407802C948009F8861D90DEC70D3" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="D2020Q3Nov05toJan03" unitRef="segment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">one</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> reportable segment. Our Chief Operating Decision Maker reviews financial information presented on a consolidated basis to evaluate company performance and to allocate resources. The change has been reflected in our segment reporting for all periods presented.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">26</span></div></div><hr Contingencies</span></ix:nonNumeric></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-86FAE75921DB7770B8B361D9129DE361-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-86FAE75921DB7770B8B361D9129DE361-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Purchase obligations</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As of </span><span
