style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708483e499-wk-Fact-A27DFE288E7FB9F8491361D91298808E" name="us-gaap:PurchaseObligation" contextRef="FI2020Q3" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">523</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> associated with agreements for purchases of goods or services, including purchase obligations associated with our discontinued operations. The amount of purchase obligations reflects estimated future payments as of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> according to the contract terms.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Deemed repatriation taxes</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we are required to pay a one-time transition tax of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708483e517-wk-Fact-4EF7B29F38F2F7BB359D61D912982687" name="us-gaap:TaxCutsAndJobsActOf2017TransitionTaxForAccumulatedForeignEarningsLiability" contextRef="FI2020Q3" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">694</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> on untaxed foreign earnings of our foreign subsidiaries due in installments through July 2025 as a result of the Tax Reform Act. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Indemnifications</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In the ordinary course of business, we may provide indemnifications of varying scope and terms to customers, vendors, lessors, business partners, subsidiaries, and other parties with respect to certain matters, including, but not limited to, losses arising out of our breach of agreements or representations and warranties made by us.</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> In addition, our bylaws contain indemnification obligations to our directors, officers, employees, and agents, and we have entered into indemnification agreements with our directors and certain of our officers to give such directors and officers additional contractual assurances regarding the scope of the indemnification set forth in our bylaws and to provide additional procedural protections. We maintain director and officer insurance, which may cover certain liabilities arising from our obligation to indemnify our directors and officers. It is not possible to determine the aggregate maximum potential loss under these indemnification agreements due to the limited history of prior indemnification claims and the unique facts and circumstances involved in each particular agreement. Such indemnification agreements might not be subject to maximum loss clauses. Historically, we have not incurred material costs as a result of obligations under these agreements, and we have not accrued any material liabilities related to such indemnification obligations in our Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In connection with the sale of Veritas and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#212529;">the sale of our Enterprise Security business to Broadcom</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we assigned several leases to Veritas Technologies LLC or Broadcom and/or their related subsidiaries. As a condition to consenting to the assignments, certain lessors required us to agree to indemnify the lessor under the applicable lease&#160;with respect to certain matters, including, but not limited to, losses arising out of Veritas Technologies LLC, Broadcom or their related subsidiaries&#8217; breach of payment obligations under the terms of the lease. As with our other indemnification obligations discussed above and in general, it is not possible to determine the aggregate maximum potential loss under these indemnification agreements due to the limited history of prior indemnification claims and the unique facts and circumstances involved in each particular agreement.&#160;As with our other indemnification obligations, such indemnification agreements might not be subject to maximum loss clauses, and to date, generally under our real estate obligations, we have not incurred material costs as a result of such obligations under our leases and have not accrued any liabilities related to such indemnification obligations in our Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We provide limited product warranties, and the majority of our software license agreements contain provisions that indemnify licensees of our software from damages and costs resulting from claims alleging that our software infringes on the intellectual property rights of a third party. Historically, payments made under these provisions have been immaterial. We monitor the conditions that are subject to indemnification to identify if a loss has occurred.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">28</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-86FAE75921DB7770B8B361D9129DE361-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-86FAE75921DB7770B8B361D9129DE361-3"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Litigation contingencies </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">SEC Investigation</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As previously disclosed in our public filings, the Audit Committee of our Board of Directors (the Audit Committee) completed its internal investigation (the Audit Committee Investigation) in September 2018. In connection with the Audit Committee Investigation, we voluntarily contacted the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in April 2018. The SEC commenced a formal investigation, and we continue to cooperate with that investigation.&#160;The outcome of such an investigation is difficult to predict. We have incurred, and will continue to incur, significant expenses related to legal and other professional services in connection with the SEC investigation. At this stage, we are unable to assess whether any material loss or adverse effect is reasonably possible as a result of the SEC&#8217;s investigation or estimate the range of any potential loss.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Securities Class Action and Derivative Litigation</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Securities class action lawsuits, which have since been consolidated, were filed in May 2018 against us and certain of our former officers, in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California. The lead plaintiff&#8217;s consolidated amended complaint alleged that, during a purported class period of May 11, 2017 to August 2, 2018, defendants made false and misleading statements in violation of Sections 10(b) and 20(a), and that certain individuals violated Section 20A, of the Securities Exchange Act. Defendants filed motions to dismiss, which the Court granted in an order dated June 14, 2019. Pursuant to that order, plaintiff filed a motion seeking leave to amend and a proposed first amended complaint on July 11, 2019. The Court granted the motion in part on October 2, 2019 and the first amended complaint was filed on October 11, 2019. The Court&#8217;s order dismissed certain claims and certain of our former officers. Defendants filed answers on November 7, 2019. No trial date has been set.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Purported shareholder derivative lawsuits have been filed against us and certain of our former officers and current and former directors in the U.S. District Courts for the District of Delaware and the Northern District of California, Delaware Chancery Court, and Delaware Superior Court, arising generally out of the same facts and circumstances as alleged in the securities class action and alleging claims for breach of fiduciary duty and related claims; these lawsuits include an action brought derivatively on behalf of our 2008 Employee Stock Purchase Plan.&#160;The derivative actions are currently voluntarily stayed in light of the securities class action. No specific amount of damages has been alleged in these lawsuits. We have also received demands from purported stockholders to inspect corporate books and records under Delaware law. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We will continue to incur legal fees in connection with these pending cases and demands, including expenses for the reimbursement of legal fees of present and former officers and directors under indemnification obligations. The expense of continuing to defend such litigation may be significant. We intend to defend these lawsuits vigorously, but there can be no assurance that we will be successful in any defense. If any of the lawsuits are decided adversely, we may be liable for significant damages directly or under our indemnification obligations, which could adversely affect our business, results of operations, and cash flows. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">At this stage, we are unable to assess whether any material loss or adverse effect is reasonably possible as a result of these lawsuits or estimate the range of any potential loss.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">GSA</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">During the first quarter of fiscal 2013, we were advised by the Commercial Litigation Branch of the Department of Justice&#8217;s (DOJ) Civil Division and the Civil Division of the U.S. Attorney&#8217;s Office for the District of Columbia that the government is investigating our compliance with certain provisions of our U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) Multiple Award Schedule Contract No. GS-35F-0240T effective January&#160;24, 2007, including provisions relating to pricing, country of origin, accessibility, and the disclosure of commercial sales practices.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As reported on the GSA&#8217;s publicly-available database, our total sales under the GSA Schedule contract were approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708483e579-wk-Fact-7E7413E22842B52F38B361D912992D80" name="us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerExcludingAssessedTax" contextRef="D2013Q2Jan01toSep30_srt_LitigationCaseAxis_symc_GeneralServicesAdministrationGsaMultipleAwardScheduleContractMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">222</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> from the period beginning January 2007 and ending September 2012. We have fully cooperated with the government throughout its investigation, and in January 2014, representatives of the government indicated that their initial analysis of our actual damages exposure from direct government sales under the GSA schedule was approximately&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708483e583-wk-Fact-DD039BBF2623D088A54961D912979C6D" name="symc:GeneralServiceAdministrationInitialAnalysisOfDamageExposure" contextRef="I2014Q4Jan31_srt_LitigationCaseAxis_symc_GeneralServicesAdministrationGsaMultipleAwardScheduleContractMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">145</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">; since the initial meeting, the government&#8217;s analysis of our potential damages exposure relating to direct sales has increased. The government has also indicated they are going to pursue claims for certain sales to California, Florida, and New York as well as sales to the federal government through reseller GSA Schedule contracts, which could significantly increase our potential damages exposure.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In 2012, a sealed civil lawsuit was filed against us related to compliance with the GSA Schedule contract and contracts with California, Florida, and New York. On July&#160;18, 2014, the Court-imposed seal expired, and the government intervened in the lawsuit. On September 16, 2014, the states of California and Florida intervened in the lawsuit, and the state of New York notified the Court that it would not intervene. On October 3, 2014, the DOJ filed an amended complaint, which did not state a specific damages amount. On October 17, 2014, California and Florida combined their claims with those of the DOJ and the relator on behalf of New York in an Omnibus Complaint, and a First Amended Omnibus Complaint was filed on October 8, 2015; the state claims also do not state specific damages amounts. On June 6, 2019, we filed a motion seeking summary judgment on all claims asserted by all plaintiffs, and the plaintiffs filed a motion for partial summary judgment on elements of liability on their claims. Both motions are currently pending before the court and NortonLifeLock is currently unable to forecast the likely outcome of these motions.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">It is possible that the litigation could lead to claims or findings of violations of the False Claims Act and could be material to our results of operations and cash flows for any period. Resolution of False Claims Act investigations can ultimately result in the </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">29</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-86FAE75921DB7770B8B361D9129DE361-3"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">payment of somewhere between one and three times the actual damages proven by the government, plus civil penalties in some cases, depending upon a number of factors. Our current estimate of the low end of the range of the probable estimated loss from this matter is&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708483e597-wk-Fact-C718BC0947793CD2D6E661D91298E81F" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="FI2020Q3_srt_LitigationCaseAxis_symc_GeneralServicesAdministrationGsaMultipleAwardScheduleContractMember_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">25</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, which we have accrued. This amount contemplates estimated losses from both the investigation of compliance with the terms of the GSA Schedule contract as well as possible violations of the False Claims Act. There is at least a reasonable possibility that a loss may have been incurred in excess of our accrual for this matter, however, we are currently unable to determine the high end of the range of estimated losses resulting from this matter.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Avila v. LifeLock et al</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On August 29, 2019 the Ninth Circuit issued a mandate remanding a securities class action lawsuit, originally filed on July&#160;22,&#160;2015, against our subsidiary, LifeLock, as well as certain of LifeLock&#8217;s former officers (the &#8220;LifeLock Defendants&#8221;) for further proceedings in the U.S. District Court for the District of Arizona. The Ninth Circuit had affirmed in part and reversed in part the August 21, 2017 decision of the District Court, which had dismissed the case with prejudice. The complaint in the remanded action alleges that, during a purported class period of July 30, 2014 to July 21, 2015, a period that predates LifeLock&#8217;s acquisition by us, the LifeLock Defendants made false and misleading statements in violation of Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act. The case is now back in the U.S. District Court for further proceedings.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We are involved in a number of other judicial and administrative proceedings that are incidental to our business. Although adverse decisions (or settlements) may occur in one or more of the cases, it is not possible to estimate the possible loss or losses from each of these cases. The final resolution of these lawsuits, individually or in the aggregate, is not expected to have a material adverse effect on our business, results of operations, financial condition or cash flows.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><a id="s56F3FE92CC20EFDEA3CF61D903D90883"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 18</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">.<ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q3YTD" name="us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock" id="TextSelection-FB05B894B8764B03586561D912DDBBEF-0-wk-Fact-CC27A27642C9EB8ED78F61D912AD937B" continuedAt="TextSelection-FB05B894B8764B03586561D912DDBBEF-1" escape="true"> </ix:nonNumeric></span><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-FB05B894B8764B03586561D912DDBBEF-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-FB05B894B8764B03586561D912DDBBEF-2"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Subsequent Events</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;"> </span></ix:continuation></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-FB05B894B8764B03586561D912DDBBEF-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Dividends</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On January 9, 2020, we announced that our Board of Directors declared a special cash dividend of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708577e492-wk-Fact-756A03F5E31DD7080273C3CDD8A9A0D4" name="symc:SpecialDividend" contextRef="I2020Q1Jan09_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usdPerShare" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> per share of common stock to be paid in January 2020. On </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">February&#160;6, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we announced that our Board of Directors declared a cash dividend of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708577e500-wk-Fact-BDE9A30FCCCC706FF95A61D912ABCD68" name="us-gaap:CommonStockDividendsPerShareDeclared" contextRef="D2020Q1Feb06_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usdPerShare" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.125</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> per share of common stock to be paid in </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">March 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. All shares of common stock issued and outstanding and all RSUs and PRUs as of the record date will be entitled to the dividend and dividend equivalents, respectively. Any future dividends and dividend equivalents will be subject to the approval of our Board of Directors. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In connection with the special dividend of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708577e511-wk-Fact-756A03F5E31DD7080273C3CDD8A9A0D4" name="symc:SpecialDividend" contextRef="I2020Q1Jan09_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usdPerShare" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> per share, on February 4, 2020, we made approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708577e515-wk-Fact-20A35EB307EC1A3CA580EE0C6BDACAC9" name="symc:PaymentsInLieuOfConversionPriceAdjustments" contextRef="D2020Q1Feb04_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">550</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> of cash payments in lieu of conversion price adjustments to the holders of our Convertible Senior Notes during our fourth quarter of fiscal 2020. See Note 9 for more information.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">S</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">ale of ID Analytics</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On January 31, 2020, we completed the sale of our ID Analytics solutions for approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d51708577e527-wk-Fact-2B5DDD5D26FDA97F491BD24D985CC105" name="us-gaap:DisposalGroupIncludingDiscontinuedOperationConsideration" contextRef="I2020Q3Jan31_us-gaap_DisposalGroupClassificationAxis_us-gaap_DisposalGroupDisposedOfBySaleNotDiscontinuedOperationsMember_us-gaap_IncomeStatementBalanceSheetAndAdditionalDisclosuresByDisposalGroupsIncludingDiscontinuedOperationsAxis_symc_IDAnalyticsSolutionsMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" proceeds.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><a id="s6E1B7C5AE943D72CE02D61D93647CBD7"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Item&#160;2.&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations</span></div><div><a id="s65EC24D20DE91BA31B1361D936531BCA"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward-looking statements and factors that may affect future results</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The discussion below contains forward-looking statements, which are subject to safe harbors under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the Securities Act) and the Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act). Forward-looking statements include references to our ability to utilize our deferred tax assets, as well as statements including words such as &#8220;expects,&#8221; &#8220;plans,&#8221; &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;estimates,&#8221; &#8220;predicts,&#8221; &#8220;goal,&#8221; &#8220;intent,&#8221; &#8220;momentum,&#8221; &#8220;projects,&#8221; and similar expressions. In addition, projections of our future financial performance; anticipated growth and trends in our businesses and in our industries; the anticipated impacts of acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, stock repurchases, and investment activities; the outcome or impact of pending litigation, claims or disputes; our intent to pay quarterly cash dividends in the future; plans for and anticipated benefits of our solutions; matters arising out of the ongoing U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) investigation; </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">anticipated tax rates, benefits and expenses; </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">and other characterizations of future events or circumstances are forward-looking statements. These statements are only predictions, based on our current expectations about future events and may not prove to be accurate. We do not undertake any obligation to update these forward-looking statements to reflect events occurring or circumstances arising after the date of this report. These forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties, and our actual results, performance, or achievements could differ materially from those expressed or implied by the forward-looking statements on the basis of several factors, including those that we discuss in Part II Item 1A, of this quarterly report on Form 10-Q. We encourage you to read that section carefully.</span></div><div><a id="s152F7F510C485962AA8161D91FEA93DA"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">OVERVIEW</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">NortonLifeLock Inc. is a global leader in consumer cyber safety. Our Norton LifeLock branded solutions help consumers protect their devices, online privacy, identity, and home networks. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On August 8, 2019, we entered into a definitive agreement with Broadcom Inc. (Broadcom) under which Broadcom agreed to purchase certain of our Enterprise Security assets and assume certain liabilities for a purchase price of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$10.7 billion</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> (the Broadcom sale). On November&#160;4, 2019, we completed the transaction.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">30</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The divestiture of our Enterprise Security business allows us to shift our operational focus to our consumer business and represents a strategic shift in our operations. As a result, the results of our Enterprise Security business were classified as discontinued operations in our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and thus excluded from both continuing operations and segment results for all periods presented. Accordingly, we now have one reportable segment. The Enterprise Security business was part of our Enterprise Security Segment. Revenues and associated costs of our ID Analytics solutions, which were formerly included in the Enterprise Security segment, are now included in our remaining reportable segment.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">In connection with the Broadcom sale, effective November 4, 2019, we changed our corporate name from Symantec Corporation to NortonLifeLock Inc.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Subsequent Events </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Special Dividend</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As a result of the Broadcom sale, we made a distribution to our stockholders through a special dividend of $12 per share of common stock, which was declared by our Board of Directors on January 9, 2020 and paid on January 31, 2020. The aggregate amount of such dividend payments was $7.2 billion. Concurrent with the payment of the special dividend, on February 4, 2020, we made $546 million of cash payments in lieu of conversion price adjustments to the holders of our Convertible Senior Notes (as defined below)</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Sale of ID Analytics solutions</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On January 31, 2020, we completed the sale of our ID Analytics solutions for approximately</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$375 million in net cash proceeds.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal calendar</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We have a 52/53-week fiscal year ending on the Friday closest to March&#160;31. The third quarter of fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and fiscal&#160;2019 each consisted of 13 weeks. The </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> consisted of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">40</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> weeks, whereas the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> consisted of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">39</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> weeks. Our </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> fiscal year consists of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">53</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> weeks and ends on </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">April&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Key financial metrics</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The following tables provide our key financial metrics for the periods presented:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Contract liabilities was relatively flat compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">March&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div></td></tr></table><div><a id="s12EB82E02D3B54F0728061D936CE6CAE"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND ESTIMATES </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The preparation of our Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements and related notes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the U.S. requires us to make estimates, including judgments and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenue, and expenses, and related disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities. We have based our estimates on historical experience and on various assumptions that we believe to be reasonable under the circumstances. We evaluate our estimates on a regular basis and make changes accordingly. Management believes that the accounting estimates employed and the resulting amounts are reasonable; however, actual results may differ from these estimates. Making estimates and judgments about future events is inherently unpredictable and is subject to significant uncertainties, some of which are beyond our control. Should any of these estimates and assumptions change or prove to have been incorrect, it could have a material impact on our results of operations, financial position and cash flows.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our critical accounting policies and estimates were disclosed in Item 7, Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">March&#160;29, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. There have been no material changes in the matters for which we make critical accounting estimates in the preparation of our Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements during the </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">nine months ended January 3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, except for those related to discontinued operations as a result of changes in reporting that relate to the Broadcom sale. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:justify;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Discontinued Operations.</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">&#160; We review the presentation of planned business dispositions in the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements based on the available information and events that have occurred. The review consists of evaluating whether the business meets the definition of a component for which the operations and cash flows are clearly distinguishable from the other components of the business, and if so, whether it is anticipated that after the disposal the cash flows of the component would be eliminated from continuing operations and whether the disposition represents a strategic shift that has a major effect on operations and financial results. In addition, we evaluate whether the business has met the criteria as a business held for sale. In order for a planned disposition to be classified as a business held for sale, the established criteria must be met as of the reporting date, including an active program to market the business and the expected disposition of the business within one year.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Planned business dispositions are presented as discontinued operations when all the criteria described above are met. For those divestitures that qualify as discontinued operations, all comparative periods presented are reclassified in the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet. Additionally, the results of operations of a discontinued operation are reclassified to income from discontinued operations, net of tax, for all periods presented. Results of discontinued operations include all revenues and expenses directly derived from such businesses; general corporate overhead is not allocated to discontinued operations. See </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Note 3</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> - Divestiture and Discontinued Operations in our Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial statements for additional information.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">32</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s33518C871C5A259F23F961D936E5E2FA"></a></div><div><div style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">8.75</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> We define direct customer revenues as revenues from sales of our consumer solutions to direct customers, which we define as those customers who have a direct billing relationship with us. Such customer sources include online acquisition and retention, affiliates, co-marketing, and original contract manufacturer channels. Direct customers excludes customers of our partners and ID Analytics solutions and direct customer revenues excludes partner revenues and ID Analytics revenues. For the three months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> partner revenues and ID Analytics revenues were $61 million and $15 million, respectively. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">33</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">For the three months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> partner revenues and ID Analytics revenues were $62 million and $13 million, respectively.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Average direct customer count presents the average of the total number of direct customers at the beginning and end of the fiscal quarter.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">ARPU is calculated as estimated direct customer revenues for the period divided by the average direct customer count for the same period, expressed as a monthly figure. We monitor APRU because it helps us understand the rate at which we are monetizing our consumer customer base.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Net revenues by geographical region</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Three Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Compared with Three Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">December&#160;28, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Sales and marketing expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$12 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to a $31 million increase in advertising and promotional expense reflecting our higher investments in direct marketing programs, partially offset by decreases in compensation expense and outside services expense, reflecting our cost reduction initiatives.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Research and development expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$38 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to an approximately $25 million decrease in compensation expense and allocated corporate shared costs, and an $8 million decrease in outside services expense, reflecting our cost reduction initiatives.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">General and administrative expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$13 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to an $8 million decrease in outside services expense and a $6 million decrease in compensation expense, reflecting our cost reduction initiatives.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Restructuring, transition and other costs increased </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$48 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to amounts recognized in connection with our fiscal 2020 restructuring plans, including </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$67 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in contract cancellation charges and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$10 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in assets write-offs in the third quarter of fiscal 2020, and a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$7 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> increase in severance costs, while in the third quarter of fiscal 2019, we incurred </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">$43 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in transition related projects costs that were completed in fiscal 2019.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nine Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Compared with Nine Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">December&#160;28, 2018</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Sales and marketing expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$14 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> primarily due to a $39 million increase advertising and promotional expense reflecting our increased investment in direct marketing programs, partially offset decreases in compensation expense and outside services expense, reflecting our cost reduction initiatives.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Research and development expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$64 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to an approximately $40 million decrease in compensation expense and allocated corporate costs, and a $18 million decrease in outside services expense.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">General and administrative expense </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$46 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to a $17 million decrease in outside services expense, a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$17 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> decrease in stock-based compensation expense, and an $8 million decrease in allocated corporate costs.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Restructuring, transition and other costs </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$59 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, primarily due to a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$162 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> decrease in costs related to transition projects that were completed in fiscal 2019, partially offset by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$67 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in contract cancellation charges incurred during the third quarter of fiscal 2020 in connection with our restructuring plans and a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$30 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> increase in severance cost.</span></div><div><a id="sA11A0B389B0D5C3B055061D92461E3AC"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our effective tax rate for continuing operations for fiscal 2020 was based on the statutory tax rate of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">21%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Our effective tax rate for continuing operations for the third quarter and the first nine months of fiscal 2020 differs from the federal statutory income tax rate primarily due to a discrete tax charge of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$53 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> related to the sale of the DigiCert equity method investment, various permanent differences and state taxes, partially offset by the benefits of lower-taxed international earnings and the research and development tax credit. In addition, for the first nine months of fiscal 2020, there was additional tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$62 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> recorded to account for uncertain tax positions related to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals&#8217; recent holding in Altera Corp. v. Commissioner.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our effective tax rate for income (loss) from continuing operations for the third quarter and the first nine months of fiscal 2019 differs from the federal statutory income tax rate primarily due to the tax expense recorded to account for one-time adjustments related to guidance issued on the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (H.R.1) (Tax Reform) and other changes in response to the Tax Reform, various permanent differences and state taxes, partially offset by the benefits of lower-taxed international earnings and the research and development tax credit.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We are a U.S.-based multinational company subject to tax in multiple U.S. and international tax jurisdictions. A substantial portion of our international earnings were generated from subsidiaries organized in Ireland and Singapore. Our results of operations would be adversely affected to the extent that our geographical mix of income becomes more weighted toward jurisdictions with higher tax rates and would be favorably affected to the extent the relative geographic mix shifts to lower tax jurisdictions. Any change in our mix of earnings is dependent upon many factors and is therefore difficult to predict.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">The timing of the resolution of income tax examinations is highly uncertain, and the amounts ultimately paid, if any, upon resolution of the issues raised by the taxing authorities may differ materially from the amounts accrued for each year. Although potential resolution of uncertain tax positions involves multiple tax periods and jurisdictions, it is reasonably possible that the gross unrecognized tax benefits related to these audits could decrease, whether by payment, release, or a combination of both, in the next 12 months by </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$17 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, which could reduce our income tax provision and therefore benefit the resulting effective tax rate.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We continue to monitor the progress of ongoing income tax controversies and the impact, if any, of the expected expiration of the statute of limitations in various taxing jurisdictions.</span></div><div><a id="s920BE7F4C32C36EF76C461D938516405"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Discontinued operations</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2,492</span></div></td><td style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Three Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Compared with Three Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">December&#160;28, 2018</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Income from discontinued operations in the third quarter of fiscal 2020 reflects a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$5,422 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> gain on the sale of Enterprise Security assets and </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$2,801 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> of related income taxes. In addition, we recognized </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$206 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in restructuring charges in the third quarter of fiscal 2020, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in the third quarter of fiscal 2019.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nine Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Compared with Nine Months Ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">December&#160;28, 2018</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Income from discontinued operations for the first nine months of fiscal 2020 reflects the impacts of the gain on sale of Enterprise Security assets discussed above. In addition, we recognized </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">$258 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in restructuring charges in the third quarter of fiscal 2020, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">$18 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in the third quarter of fiscal 2019. Further, during the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we recognized a </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$665 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> tax benefit resulting from the remeasurement of the deferred tax assets associated with the tax basis of intellectual property held by our subsidiaries organized in Ireland. We previously expected to recover the tax basis through normal operation of our Enterprise business, which is taxed at the Irish trading rate of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">12.5%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Instead, we recovered the tax basis through the sale of certain assets of the Enterprise Security assets, which is taxed at the Irish capital gains tax rate of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">33%</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">36</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s534BA5FFFA9A91EE61B061D912FBFEA2"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">LIQUIDITY, CAPITAL RESOURCES AND CASH REQUIREMENTS </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We have historically relied on cash generated from operations, borrowings under credit facilities, issuances of debt, and proceeds from divestitures for our liquidity needs.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we had cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$12.8 billion</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, of which </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$1.1 billion</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> was held by our foreign subsidiaries. Our cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments are managed with the objective to preserve principal, maintain liquidity, and generate investment returns. The participation exemption system under current U.S. federal tax regulations generally allows us to make distributions of non-U.S. earnings to the U.S. without incurring additional U.S. federal tax, however these distributions may be subject to applicable state or non-U.S. taxes. We have not recognized deferred income taxes for local country income and withholding taxes that could be incurred on distributions of certain non-U.S. earnings or for outside basis differences in our subsidiaries, because we plan to indefinitely reinvest such earnings and basis differences.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">We also have an undrawn credit facility of $1.0 billion which expires in November 2024.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our principal cash requirements are primarily to meet our working capital needs, support on-going business activities, including the payment of taxes, fund capital expenditures, payments of cash dividends, service existing debt, and invest in business acquisitions.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our capital allocation strategy is to balance driving stockholder returns, managing financial risk, and preserving our flexibility to pursue strategic options, including acquisitions. Historically this has included a quarterly cash dividend, the repayment of debt and the repurchase of our common stock.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Sale of equity method investment</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On October 16, 2019, Clearlake Capital Group, L.P. (Clearlake), a private investment firm, and TA Associates, an existing investor of DigiCert and a private equity firm, completed an investment in DigiCert. As a part of the transaction, Clearlake and TA became equal partners in DigiCert. As a result, we received $378 million in cash for our equity investment in DigiCert. We expect to make income tax payments of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$53 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> as a result of the transaction.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Divestiture of Enterprise Security business</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">November&#160;4, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, we completed the sale of certain assets and the assumption of certain liabilities of our Enterprise Security business to Broadcom for a purchase price of $10.7 billion. In connection with the transaction, we incurred direct costs of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$38 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. We expect to pay approximately $1.9 billion for U.S. and foreign income taxes as a res</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;background-color:#ffffff;">ult of the transaction, mostly within the next twelve months.</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As a result of the divestiture, we made a distribution to our stockholders through a special dividend of $12 per share of common stock, which was declared by our Board of Directors on January 9, 2020 and paid on January 31, 2020. The aggregate amount of such dividend payments was $7.2 billion. Concurrent with the payment of the special dividend, on February 4, 2020, we made $546 million of cash payments in lieu of conversion price adjustments to the holders of our Convertible Senior Notes</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">S</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">ale of ID Analytics solutions</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">On January 31, 2020, we completed the sale of our ID Analytics solutions for approximately</span><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$375 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in net cash proceeds.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Share Repurchase Program</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">During the three and nine months ended January 3, 2020, we executed repurchases of 14 million and 39 million shares of our common stock, respectively, under our existing share repurchase program for an aggregate amounts of $363 million and $904 million, respectively.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash flows</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:normal;">The following summarizes our cash flow activities:</span></div><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">(1,037</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div with our discontinued operations. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our cash flows for the first nine months of fiscal 2020 reflected net income of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$3,656 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, adjusted by non-cash items, including gain on sale of Enterprise Security assets of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$5,422 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, gain on sale of equity method investment of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$379 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;" href="#sD6598B21B56EA59F126161D92EA0438D"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span stock-based compensation expense of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$270 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, compared to a net loss of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$265 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> for the first nine months of fiscal 2019. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Changes in operating assets and liabilities in the first nine months of fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> consisted primarily of the following:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Income tax payable </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">increased </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$2,096 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, compared to a decrease of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$17 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in the first nine months of fiscal 2019, primarily due to our U.S. and foreign tax obligations from the gain on sale of Enterprise Security assets to Broadcom in the third quarter of fiscal 2020. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Accounts receivable</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> decreased </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$537 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$97 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in the first nine months of fiscal 2019, primarily due to the absence of Enterprise Security billings after the close of the Broadcom sale but continued collections of those receivables thereafter.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Contract liabilities</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> decreased </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$163 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in the nine months ended January 3, 2020, excluding the derecognition of contract liabilities related to the Broadcom sale, compared to an increase of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$59 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> in the first nine months of fiscal 2019. This decrease reflects higher Enterprise Security revenues than recognized than billings from the period of March 29, 2019 through the date of the Broadcom sale.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cash from investing activities</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">Our investing activities in the first nine months of fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> consisted primarily of cash proceeds from the Broadcom sale, net of transaction costs, of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$10,572 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, proceeds from sale of equity method investment of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$378 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, and proceeds from maturities and sales of short-term investments of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$135 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, partially offset by capital expenditures of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$86 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. Our investing activities in the first nine months of fiscal 2019 consisted primarily of capital expenditures of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$153 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, partially offset by cash proceeds from maturities and sales of short-term investments of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$119 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span the first nine months of fiscal 2019.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:9pt;"><span Our financing activities in the first nine months of fiscal 2019 included payment of dividends and dividend equivalents of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$169 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;"> and tax withholding payments related to restricted stock units of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$168 million</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash requirements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:17px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Debt - </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;3, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, our total outstanding principal amount of indebtedness was </span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">$4.5 billion</span><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;">, summarized as follows.
